abstract: BACKGROUND: Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) is a common autosomal dominant genetic disorder characterized by café-au-lait macules, neurofibromas, and other manifestations. It is caused by variations in the  CASE PRESENTATION: A 26-year-old Chinese woman was admitted to our hospital with multiple café-au-lait spots and cutaneous nodules. She had a family history of NF1, with her mother also showing similar dermatological symptoms. Whole exome sequencing (WES) identified a synonymous variation, NM_001042492.3: c.987A>G (p.K329K), in the  CONCLUSION: The case highlights the critical role of synonymous variations in the
